abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, and sustainability likely, though only modest
            institutional development impacts were achieved. Among the
            lessons learned, it is specifically addressed that special
            attention should have been given during project preparation,
            to the design, and implementation of technical assistance in
            strengthening institutional capacity, by establishing the
            Borrower's commitment, and anticipating potential
            disruptive factors, such as the lack of appropriate
            counterpart staff. This requires that the Bank stay focused
            on institutional development objectives, to avoid
            unsuccessful arrangements - as in the case of the twinning
            contract - where alternative options, such as the engagement
            of a private operator, should have been pursued. In
            addition, the Bank also needs to take into account the
            broader objectives, and impacts of the project in the
            setting of a monitoring and evaluation system, for while
            physical, and institutional progress indicators were
            developed, the system did not provide for evaluating
            progress in achieving the larger objectives. Special
            attention is also necessary in defining action programs with
            committed support, e.g., on the reduction in non-revenue and
            unaccounted for water, and, in establishing technical, and
            financial viability of local contractors, to avoid delays,
            e.g., the sewage treatment plants.
